### Tupper Needs Help

* Challenge

```
I forgot the size of my kipod, can you help? k = 
```

* Recon and Attempts

  - Using python

```
>>> k = ""
>>> len(k)
541
>>> int(k)

>>> import sys
>>> sys.getsizeof(k)
578

>>> k = 
>>> sys.getsizeof(k)
264
```
* getsizeof() returns bytes, also tried bits value with 264*8 == 2112 

* Tried using C and Go with long long int types, this seems to be very large. Also tried integer arrays as well. Go lang sizeof also was not successfull.

* Greedily tried int()*len(array) == 4 * 514 = 2164 ( also tried *8 for bits at 17312 )

* Read about Googol --> GoogolPlex --> GoogolPlexPlex ( Nothing worked )

* I was talking to my colleague and he suggested an idea that was more interesting... --> 541*((log(10)/log(2))/8) or 
```
>>> s = ""
>>> len(s)
1795
>>> 1795//8
224
```

* boltzmnn constant?  No did not work....

* After a while of retrying the same shit again
```
>>> import sys
>>> sys.getsizeof()
264
>>> 264*8
2112
>>> s = ""
>>> len(s)
541
>>> 8*541
4328
>>> 4*541
2164
>>> sys.getsizeof(s)
578
>>> 
```

* I thought I can GOOGLE again --> Keyword: `Tupper k` --> This led to something interesting....
```
Tupper's Self-Referential Formula
```

* An online tool at `http://keelyhill.github.io/tuppers-formula/` gives the answer when the decimal is filled with K.
```
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tupper's_self-referential_formula
```

* OK! Finally ---> the flag `KAF{MY_KIPOD_IS_HUGE}`
